00016 const UINT32 Task::kDefaultPriority;
00017 const INT32 Task::kInvalidTaskID;

00026 Task::Task(const char* name, FUNCPTR function, INT32 priority, UINT32 stackSize)
00027 {
00028     m_taskID = kInvalidTaskID;
00029     m_function = function;
00030     m_priority = priority;
00031     m_stackSize = stackSize;
00032     m_taskName = new char[strlen(name) + 5];
00033     strcpy(m_taskName, "FRC_");
00034     strcpy(m_taskName+4, name);
00035 }
00036 
00037 Task::~Task()
00038 {
00039     if (m_taskID != kInvalidTaskID) Stop();
00040     delete [] m_taskName;
00041     m_taskName = NULL;
00042 }
00043 
00048 bool Task::Start(UINT32 arg0, UINT32 arg1, UINT32 arg2, UINT32 arg3, UINT32 arg4, 
00049         UINT32 arg5, UINT32 arg6, UINT32 arg7, UINT32 arg8, UINT32 arg9)
00050 {
00051     m_taskID = taskSpawn(m_taskName,
00052                         m_priority,
00053                         VX_FP_TASK,                         // options
00054                         m_stackSize,                        // stack size
00055                         m_function,                         // function to start
00056                         arg0, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4,   // parameter 1 - pointer to this class
00057                         arg5, arg6, arg7, arg8, arg9);// additional unused parameters
00058     bool ok = HandleError(m_taskID);
00059     if (!ok) m_taskID = kInvalidTaskID;
00060     return ok;
00061 }
00062 
00068 bool Task::Restart(void)
00069 {
00070     return HandleError(taskRestart(m_taskID));
00071 }
00072 
00077 bool Task::Stop(void)
00078 {
00079     bool ok = true;
00080     if (Verify())
00081     {
00082         ok = HandleError(taskDelete(m_taskID));
00083     }
00084     m_taskID = kInvalidTaskID;
00085     return ok;
00086 }
00087 
00092 bool Task::IsReady(void)
00093 {
00094     return taskIsReady(m_taskID);
00095 }

00101 bool Task::IsSuspended(void)
00102 {
00103     return taskIsSuspended(m_taskID);

00110 bool Task::Suspend(void)
00111 {
00112     return HandleError(taskSuspend(m_taskID));
00113 }

00119 bool Task::Resume(void)
00120 {
00121     return HandleError(taskResume(m_taskID));
00122 }
00123 
00128 bool Task::Verify(void)
00129 {
00130     return taskIdVerify(m_taskID) == OK;
00131 }
00132 
00137 INT32 Task::GetPriority(void)
00138 {
00139     if (HandleError(taskPriorityGet(m_taskID, &m_priority)))
00140         return m_priority;
00141     else
00142         return 0;
00143 }
00144 
00152 bool Task::SetPriority(INT32 priority)
00153 {
00154     m_priority = priority;
00155     return HandleError(taskPrioritySet(m_taskID, m_priority));
00156 }
00157 
00162 const char* Task::GetName(void)
00163 {
00164     return m_taskName;
00165 }
00166 
00171 INT32 Task::GetID(void)
00172 {
00173     if (Verify())
00174         return m_taskID;
00175     return kInvalidTaskID;
00176 }
00177 
00181 bool Task::HandleError(STATUS results)
00182 {
00183     if (results != ERROR) return true;
00184     switch(errnoGet())
00185     {
00186     case S_objLib_OBJ_ID_ERROR:
00187         wpi_fatal(TaskIDError);
00188         break;
00189         
00190     case S_objLib_OBJ_DELETED:
00191         wpi_fatal(TaskDeletedError);
00192         break;
00193         
00194     case S_taskLib_ILLEGAL_OPTIONS:
00195         wpi_fatal(TaskOptionsError);
00196         break;
00197         
00198     case S_memLib_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY:
00199         wpi_fatal(TaskMemoryError);
00200         break;
00201         
00202     case S_taskLib_ILLEGAL_PRIORITY:
00203         wpi_fatal(TaskPriorityError);
00204         break;
00205 
00206     default:
00207         printErrno(errnoGet());
00208         wpi_fatal(TaskError);
00209     }
00210     return false;
00211 }
